article.title: SAIC to Support Sensors in Afghanistan
article.author: George I. Seffers
article.text: Science Applications International Corp., McLean, Va., was awarded a $56,275,374 cost-plus-fixed-fee contract for the services in support of sensor technologies to the Army’s current force architecture. Work will be performed in Afghanistan, with an estimated completion date of Sept. 25, 2014. The U.S. Army Contracting Command, Alexandria, Va., is the contracting activity.
